pros: Great benefits, supportive atmosphere, high professional standards.
cons: Rural location impact on social determinants of health.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Saint Johnsbury, VT
pros: Close knit community in which you feel a sense of personal pride and accountability for the care provided. Allows you to feel that you have a voice for change, unlike some larger hospitals.
cons: Small, critical access hospital. Do not take care of critical patients long term (transferred out to tertiary centers for the most part).

review_title: Great place to work, best IT team in Northern New England
job_title: Network Engineer II in East St Johnsbry, VT
pros:
-> Management is great in the IT dept
-> PTO is generous
-> Clear pathways for advancement
-> Team collaboration
-> Provides training when requested
cons: -> 24/7 so sometimes it can be a challenge to coordinate projects, but other than that no big cons

review_title: Small town ideas to no ones benefit.
pros: Most of the people who work here are truly great people. Friendly, hard working. Great cafeteria. The hospital has a wonderful commitment to community outreach & programs. Mostly amazing progressive doctors that are respectful and treat nursing staff as integral members of the team.
cons:
I’m not sure whether it has something to do with being a small town hospital, but it is unbelievably clannish. From the CEO to the CNO to the managers of nearly all the departments, promotion has nothing to do with qualifications and almost entirely based on who you know and how long you’ve been here. Management seems almost allergic to giving upper end jobs to people not already employed here. The CEO loves to talk about “promoting from within” which is not a bad thing, but when they repeatedly overlook potentially really great people from outside for something they already know, it’s the institution that suffers. New people bring in new ideas and this hospital has very little tolerance for anything that might change the status quo.
Also the CEO is pathologically obsessed with profit. The very first thing he did when Covid hit was ask everyone to take a 10% pay cut, including all the frontline workers putting their lives at risk by showing up to work. And he continued to support us by sending weekly financial updates from his home computer. Meanwhile we are some of the lowest paid nurses in the entire state. You get the idea.
The only time you see the CNO is passing by her eating her lunch in the cafeteria or if you go to her office. She is completely vacant to the nurses.
A few horrible doctors that think nurses are morons and treat us as such.

pros: I have worked to NVRH Corner Medical for 17 years.  I feel appreciated and respected as a member of our medical team.  The medical practice is busy but you never feel overwhelmed and you are always offered help by your fellow workers.   Team work is wonderful between the provider, nurse, office manager, and the support staff.  Great place to work.

job_title: Secretary In Medical Office in Lyndonville, VT
pros: Our medical practice has an amazing team of Providers,Nurses and Support staff that go above and beyond their daily duties. It's a joy going to work everyday knowing that everyone is making the patient the main focus. I always feel appreciated by the whole medical team. They also offer good medical benefits and earned time which is a plus. Corner Medical is a fun to work.
cons: Still looking for primary care providers to join our team.

job_title: Information Technology in Saint Johnsbury, VT
pros: They exercise every good quality to make a happy company. Outgoing leaders, kind and welcoming colleagues, many community events to build a personal relationship with surroundings, and offers good opportunities to build your education/experience.
cons: The location is very rural so if you are not an outdoors type of person you may not want to  consider here.

review_title: Wonderful small community hospital that attempts to provide care for community members beyond its brick walls.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Johnsbury, VT
pros: 20 hours per week equals full medical benefits
cons: years of service and education do not always comensurate with pay

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Johnsbury, VT
pros: We have a great Chief Nurse he is visible and  approachable. I wish all leaders at our hospital were like him.
cons: I work in the clinics and report to a non clinical manager. Nurses should report to a Nurse and not to managers who not  clinicians and have no idea about the value of nursing.
